DOC.HEAD: Eds: Fixes time to 11 a.m. in 2nd graf
DOC.TEXT: The stock market was narrowly mixed today, steadying after Friday's decline. The Dow Jones average of 30 industrials, down 14.08 on Friday, edged up 2.56 to 2,742.11 by 11 a.m. today on Wall Street. Losers outnumbered gainers by about 7 to 6 in nationwide trading of New York Stock Exchange-listed issues, with 556 up, 671 down and 525 unchanged. Volume on the Big Board came to 49.30 million shares at midmorning. Brokers said traders remained uneasy about the outlook for real-estate finance and regional bank stocks after the Bank of New England on Friday announced projected increases in its loan-loss reserve and non-performing assets. In the past couple of weeks, Wall Street has been devoting increased concern to the soft real estate market in many parts of the country and the problems real-estate debt might pose should prices of properties lag for an extended period. Bank of New England shares led the active list, down ~ at 8[ on the heels of a 3]-point drop Friday. Among other actively traded banking and mortgage issues, Bank of Boston lost } to 16] and Federal National Mortgage was down 1\ at 32{. Otherwise, analysts said hopes persisted that stocks could overcome their recent hesitancy and gain ground in the next few weeks, aided by the lifting of pressures from yearend tax selling. Marriott rose 1[ to 35}. The company announced a restructuring plan that calls for its departure from the fast-food and family restaurant business and the buyback of an additional 10 million of its shares. The NYSE's composite index of all its listed common stocks slipped .08 to 198.37. At the American Stock Exchange, the market value index was off .81 at 374.69.
